0.title: Modified 'Laal...' based on reaction by Rajamouli, Nagarjuna: Aamir
0.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan said he made a change in his film 'Laal Singh Chaddha' based on the reactions of 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli, 'Pushpa: The Rise' director Sukumar and actors Nagarjuna and Chiranjeevi. "The change was very correct," he added. Aamir organised a special screening of 'Laal Singh Chaddha' for them, following which Chiranjeevi hugged Aamir who was in tears.

1.title: There is no good, bad Taliban; will never support terrorism: Digvijaya
1.article_body: Former Madhya Pradesh CM and Congress MP Digvijaya Singh has said that he commends the elimination of Al Qaeda's chief Ayman al- Zawahiri. "There is no Good Taliban and Bad Taliban," Singh said. He added, "My BJP-Sanghi friends have an illness of speaking lies. I will never support terrorism...irrespective of which country or religion they belong to."

2.title: Corruption charges against Opposition leaders based on evidence: BJP
2.article_body: BJP on Tuesday refuted indulging in vendetta politics, saying charges of corruption against Opposition leaders are based on evidence and facts, not rhetoric. "The Opposition shouldn't politicise corruption," BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra said. He added BJP will never interfere in the work of investigation agencies. This comes after Sena MP Sanjay Raut was arrested by ED in Patra Chawl scam.

3.title: Man dies after falling into cauldron of porridge at temple in TN's Madurai
3.article_body: A man reportedly died of burn injuries after he fell into a cauldron of porridge at Muthu Mariyammam temple in Tamil Nadu's Madurai. The man, Muthukumar, fainted and lost his balance before falling into the cauldron, a CCTV footage of the incident showed. People pulled Muthukumar out of the cauldron and rushed him to a nearby hospital.

4.title: 6 more held in K'taka in Fazil murder case; police say 'attack pre-planned'
4.article_body: Police in Karnataka's Mangaluru have arrested six more persons in connection with the murder of 23-year-old Fazil in the Surathkal area on July 28. According to police, the attack was pre-planned and the accused had been observing Fazil for a few days before attacking him. So far, around 51 people have been questioned in this connection, police added.

5.title: Mumbai-Nagpur expressway's first phase likely to be inaugurated on Aug 15
5.article_body: Mumbai-Nagpur expressway's first phase, a 480 km stretch between Shirdi and Nagpur, has been completed and is intended to be inaugurated on August 15, said Radheshyam Mopalwar, MD of Maharashtra State Road Development Corporation. "We're planning to complete the entire 700-km stretch by end of May 2023," he said. "Toll collection systems, petrol pumps, everything is ready," he added.

6.title: Vehicle carrying Central Vista workers hits bus in Delhi; 28 hospitalised
6.article_body: As many as 28 people were taken to a hospital after a private vehicle, in which labourers from the Central Vista project were travelling, hit a cluster bus from behind in Delhi's Ranjeet Nagar on Tuesday, police said. The private vehicle's driver suffered severe injuries, police added. Of those injured, three people were from the cluster bus, police further added.

7.title: BMTC introduces new bus route between Silk Institute metro and airport
7.article_body: The Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) has added a new Vayuvajra bus route called 'KIA-5D' connecting commuters from the Silk Institute metro station to Kempegowda International Airport (KIA). This route takes commuters from Silk Institute to Bengaluru airport through the Konanakunte Cross, Banashankari, Jayanagara 4th Block, Shanthinagara TTMC, RM Guttahalli and Hebbala.

8.title: You take 100-200 days to finish film, Akshay does in 30 days: Kareena to Aamir
8.article_body: In the promo of the upcoming episode of 'Koffee With Karan 7', actress Kareena Kapoor Khan can be seen telling actor Aamir Khan that he takes 100-200 days to finish a film while actor Akshay Kumar finishes one in 30 days. Her comment came in response to being asked what she tolerates in Aamir but wouldn't tolerate in others.

9.title: We were back in the game thanks to our bowlers: India bowling coach Mhambrey
9.article_body: India bowling coach Paras Mhambrey has said they have a lot of positives to take from their defeat in the second T20I against the West Indies. "We didn't have many runs...[but] we pretty much came [back] in the game thanks to our bowers," added Mhambrey. "I'm happy with the potential [young bowlers] have shown in [recent] games," he further said.

10.title: Kanpur school manager booked after students forced to recite 'Kalma'
10.article_body: The manager of Florets International School in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur has been booked after students were allegedly forced to recite 'Kalma' during morning prayers. This comes after a student's father alleged that "seeds of conversion" were being sown in children at the school. "Now, only the National Anthem is being sung during morning prayers," Kanpur ACP Nishank Sharma said.

11.title: Mob storms into check post, attacks police & frees drug smuggler in Punjab
11.article_body: A group of people, including women, reportedly stormed into the Chawinda Devi police check post that falls under the jurisdiction of Amritsar Rural Police on Monday. They attacked four on-duty policemen and freed an alleged drug smuggler from their custody. The crowd claimed the man, who was caught with nine grams of heroin, wasn't a smuggler but a drug addict.

12.title: Johar, Pandya, KL Rahul found innocent by court over comments on women on 'Koffee...'
12.article_body: The Jodhpur High Court granted relief to cricketers Hardik Pandya and KL Rahul and director Karan Johar, in a case registered against the trio. It was registered for alleged offensive remarks on women made by the cricketers on 'Koffee with Karan' in 2018. According to reports, the court disposed of the case after they were found 'innocent'.

13.title: Outstanding accomplishment: PM as UPI transactions hit record 6 billion in July
13.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has lauded the "outstanding accomplishment" of record number of UPI transactions in July. About 6.28 billion UPI transactions worth over ₹10.62 lakh crore took place last month, the highest ever since UPI's inception in 2016. "It indicates the collective resolve of the people of India to embrace new technologies and make the economy cleaner," the PM said.

14.title: Unacademy suspends contracts of some educators, to cut doubt-solving: Report
14.article_body: Edtech unicorn Unacademy has suspended contracts of some of its doubt-solving NEET and IIT-JEE educators for a minimum of six months, Moneycontrol reported. In an email to educators, Unacademy said it will "significantly" reduce doubt solving on its platform. Last month, CEO Gaurav Munjal announced a slew of measures to cut costs, including pay cuts for founders and top management.

15.title: BharatPe Co-founder Bhavik Koladiya resigns months after Ashneer Grover's exit
15.article_body: BharatPe's Co-founder Bhavik Koladiya, who ran the product and technology operations for the company, has quit. While BharatPe said Koladiya wants to "spend time on other assignments outside" the firm, a report, while quoting sources, said that he resigned due to disagreements with CEO Suhail Sameer. His resignation comes months after the exit of BharatPe's other Co-founder Ashneer Grover.

16.title: I won't do any more projects if I do Bhansali's 'Heeramandi': Mumtaz
16.article_body: Veteran actress Mumtaz has said she would not do any more projects if she does filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Heeramandi'. "Sanjay is the best filmmaker in India. I would love to work with him if I like my role [in 'Heeramandi']," she added. She further said that she does not have the "liberty" to discuss anything about the film.

17.title: Man stabs cousin 38 times over old dispute in Pune's Baramati; held
17.article_body: A 27-year-old barber was allegedly stabbed to death 38 times by his maternal cousin in a village near Baramati on Monday, Pune Rural Police said. The victim, Gajanan Pawar, was allegedly attacked by the accused, Santosh Gulmule, after an altercation broke out between them over an old dispute. Gulmule was arrested from a railway station while trying to escape.

18.title: Delhi HC quashes rape FIR, tells complainant to offer social service
18.article_body: The Delhi High Court has quashed a rape FIR by a woman complainant with a direction to her to offer social service at All India Confederation of the Blind for two months. The case was settled before the court hearing under which it stated that the parties had a money dispute. The accused has been directed to plant 50 trees.

19.title: Dhoni visits us, he said he plays lawn bowls in Australia: Lovely who reached CWG final
19.article_body: Lovely Choubey, who's a part of India's women's fours lawn bowls team that reached final at CWG 2022, said MS Dhoni knows a lot about their sport. She added he knows their coach and visits them in Ranchi. "We had a chat about the sport as well. He said...whenever he's in Australia he goes to play lawn bowls," Lovely said.

20.title: Taiwan starts 'preparing for war' with China
20.article_body: The Taiwanese Ministry of National Defense has begun to "immediately prepare for war" and has put the military on high alert, local news outlets reported. This comes amid repeated Chinese warnings of military action over the reported upcoming visit of US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi. Taiwan is reportedly preparing air-raid shelters for citizens and has cancelled soldiers' and officers' leaves.

21.title: Delhi HC quashes Arms Act FIR against man, tells him to give sanitisers to students
21.article_body: Delhi High Court quashed an FIR against a US resident who was found with a live bullet at the Indira Gandhi International Airport. The man had claimed that his uncle used a licensed weapon during celebratory firing at Diwali and a cartridge remained in his pocket. The court directed him to distribute mosquito repellents and hand sanitisers to school students.

22.title: 4 doctors, a manager booked for negligence after fire kills 8 at MP hospital
22.article_body: Four doctors and a manager were booked for negligence after a fire broke out at a private hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur and killed eight people. The doctors are absconding, while the manager has been arrested, police said. "If government officials are found involved for giving permissions overlooking lapses, a case will be registered against them," SP Siddharth Bahuguna said.

23.title: Musk sued by Twitter investor with 5,500 shares over $44 bn buyout deal
23.article_body: A Twitter investor holding 5,500 shares has sued Tesla CEO Elon Musk with proposed class action and has named two "corporate acquisition entities" related to the deal as defendants apart from Musk. The shareholder seeks a court order compelling Musk to go through with his $44 billion deal. The new suit targets Musk's "lame rationales for reneging on his contract".

24.title: Twitter banned 43,140 Indian users in June for violating guidelines
24.article_body: Twitter banned 43,140 accounts of Indian users in June 2022 over violation of its guidelines, according to Twitter's July 2022 compliance report. Twitter removed 40,982 accounts for child sexual exploitation, non-consensual nudity and similar content, while 2,158 accounts were banned for promoting terrorism. Twitter's local grievance mechanism received 724 grievances between May 26 and June 25.

25.title: ED investigates GST number linked to Arpita Mukherjee
25.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) is investigating a GST number linked to former Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee’s close aide Arpita Mukherjee in connection to the SSC scam. "She used one GST number for running a beauty parlour business. We are trying to find out whether this one was generated in an illegal manner to evade taxes," an ED official said.

26.title: Cabinet rejig is to divert attention: BJP Bengal Chief
26.article_body: BJP Bengal chief Sukanta Majumdar on Monday took a potshot at CM Mamata Banerjee over Cabinet reshuffle. “Banerjee is taking such decisions to divert the media’s attention from the corruption cases,” said Majumdar while referring to the arrest of former Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee. Earlier, Mamata had announced to reshuffle the Cabinet.

27.title: CM Shinde cancels garden inauguration in Pune after controversy over name
27.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde cancelled a garden inauguration programme in Pune after controversy erupted over reports that the garden was developed on public land and named after him. "We have cancelled the inauguration. We will put up a proposal with the name of the garden to Pune Municipal Corporation's garden committee for further decision," Shinde supporter Nana Bhangire said.

28.title: BJP, Cong workers clash in Tripura's Charilam; Section 144 imposed
28.article_body: CrPC Section 144 was imposed in Tripura's Charilam after a clash broke out between the workers of BJP and Congress. The police said that a group of BJP workers tried to provoke people during a political event organised by the Congress, after which they resorted to lathi charge. Meanwhile, Deputy CM Jishnu Dev Varma blamed the Congress for triggering violence.

29.title: Peacock wrapped in Tiranga after death in UP's Ghaziabad, video surfaces
29.article_body: A peacock was wrapped in Tiranga after it passed away in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad. A video that surfaced online showed police personnel carrying the body of the peacock, wrapped in India's national flag, on a stretcher. According to reports, a Twitter user mentioned that the peacock was found dead at the Kaushambi metro station of the region.

30.title: Bengaluru likely to witness heavy rainfall today, tomorrow: IMD
30.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted that urban areas in Bengaluru are likely to witness heavy rainfall today and tomorrow. This comes after heavy showers in the city on Monday evening left several areas inundated. While power outages were reported in BTM and HSR Layout, water entered houses in Yelahanka, Yelachenahalli and some regions in north Bengaluru, reports said.

31.title: Biden says he's ready for nuclear deal with Russia as UN talks begin
31.article_body: US President Joe Biden said he is ready for new nuclear arms deal with Russia, calling upon Russian President Vladimir Putin to act in good faith. In a written statement to NPT review conference, Putin said that there will be no winners in a nuclear war. Putin had put nuclear arms on high alert days after Russian invasion of Ukraine.

32.title: Nuclear annihilation just one miscalculation away, warns UN chief
32.article_body: The world is "just one misunderstanding, one miscalculation away from nuclear annihilation", UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said while speaking at the opening of a Nuclear Non-proliferation Treaty conference. The conference is taking place "at a time of nuclear danger not seen since the height of the Cold War", he added, citing Russia-Ukraine war and "many other factors around the world".

33.title: Container truck carrying chemical overturns on Ghodbunder Road in Thane
33.article_body: A container truck transporting tanks of hydrogen peroxide chemical overturned on the busy Ghodbunder Road in Maharashtra's Thane on Tuesday. The gas from the container leaked on the road, emitting a foul odour. The accident resulted in a huge traffic jam, officials said. "There are no cases of anyone affected due to the chemical leak," an official said.

34.title: Has any BJP leader faced CBI, ED action: NCP youth wing poster in Aurangabad
34.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party's youth wing has put up banners in Maharashtra's Aurangabad, asking if any leader from the Bharatiya Janata Party has ever faced CBI or ED action. The poster that has NYC state secretary Akshay Patil's picture and contact details, also asked if any agency continued its probe against a leader after they switched over to the BJP.

35.title: 1.6 million coca leaf bushes seized in Honduras
35.article_body: Honduran authorities seized more than 1.6 million coca leaf bushes on Monday. Officials said that the bushes, used to make cocaine, were located in mountainous areas in the coastal department of Colon after a three-day operation. According to security forces statistics, total 2,625,015 bushes have been seized this year, significantly up from 531,826 bushes seized in 2021.

36.title: WI's Obed McCoy dedicates 'Man of the Match' award vs India to his mother
36.article_body: West Indies pacer Obed McCoy, who broke the record for best-ever T20I bowling figures against India in the second T20I on Monday, dedicated his 'Man of the Match' award to his mother. "She is sick and she has motivated me to be a better player," said McCoy at the post-match presentation. McCoy registered figures of 4-1-17-6 in the match.

37.title: Ex-K'taka minister's employee steals valuables from his B'luru home, arrested
37.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested an employee of former Karnataka Home Minister MB Patil for allegedly stealing foreign currency and valuables from his house in Bengaluru's Sadashivanagar. The accused, Jayanth Kumar, is a native of Odisha. Kumar used to work as a laundryman at Patil's home, police said, adding that he gifted the stolen watches to his friends in Odisha.

38.title: Goa CM urges citizens to join ‘Har Ghar Tiranga’ campaign
38.article_body: Ahead of the country's 75th Independence Day celebrations, Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant urged people to participate in the ‘Har Ghar Tiranga’ campaign and hoist the tricolour flag at their houses from August 13 to 16. “I urge Goans to keep the national flag as their display picture on social media from August 2 onwards,” Sawant said.

39.title: Polio was in NYC wastewater a month before case was detected: Official
39.article_body: New York health officials said that polio virus was present in wastewater of New York City suburb a month before health officials confirmed a case last month. In an emailed statement, US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said there may be more people shedding the virus in their stool. Officials urged residents to be sure they are vaccinated.

40.title: Went wicketless after Murali wished me luck: Nilesh on 1997 Test vs SL
40.article_body: Recalling a Test match against Sri Lanka in 1997, ex-India spinner Nilesh Kulkarni said he got a wicket off his first ball in the match, but couldn't take a wicket in the game after that. "I'd met Muttiah Muralitharan...[after the day's play], he said '...Good luck for...next three days'. Little did I realise...I wouldn't pick a wicket," added Nilesh.

41.title: Storms hit Kentucky's flooded areas, curfews imposed due to looting
41.article_body: Disaster-hit areas in eastern Kentucky witnessed another round of storms on Monday. Death toll due to floods rose to 37 on Tuesday. According to Governor, rescue operations continue at a time when hundreds of people remain unaccounted for. Authorities declared county-wide nighttime curfews amidst looting reports in Breathitt County and Hindman in Knott County, which are devastated due to floods.

42.title: Go First car goes under IndiGo plane, narrowly avoiding collision at Delhi airport
42.article_body: A car belonging to Go First airline went under an IndiGo aircraft at Delhi airport on Tuesday, narrowly avoiding collision with the plane's nose wheel. The aircraft was readying to depart for Dhaka when the incident took place. A video of the incident has also surfaced on social media. According to officials, the DGCA will investigate the incident.

43.title: Whenever you do 'Koffee...' someone cries: Aamir Khan to Karan Johar
43.article_body: During his appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7' which is hosted by filmmaker Karan Johar, actor Aamir Khan said, "Whenever you do your show, someone...cries." Aamir was accompanied by actress Kareena Kapoor. Responding to a question about the thing she tolerates about Aamir, Kareena stated him taking 100-200 days for shooting a film, which Akshay Kumar does in 30 days.

44.title: I really have to work on my phrasing: Brad Pitt on retirement claim
44.article_body: On being asked about his statement of being in the "last semester or trimester" of his career, actor Brad Pitt said that he really has to work on his phrasing. "I was just saying I'm past middle age and I want to be specific about how I spend those last things however they may be," the actor added.

45.title: Arshdeep has bowled tough overs for PBKS, that's why he was confident vs WI: Parthiv
45.article_body: Talking about pacer Arshdeep Singh, ex-India cricketer Parthiv Patel said the 23-year-old was "confident" in his bowling in the second T20I against West Indies on Monday. "Arshdeep has been bowling those tough overs [for PBKS], that's the reason why you could see the confidence in him," added Parthiv. Arshdeep registered figures of 1/26 off his four overs in the game.

46.title: DDA's cash deficit due to unsold housing inventory of ₹18,000 cr: Govt
46.article_body: Delhi Development Authority's cash deficit of ₹9,615 crore is primarily due to unsold housing inventory worth around ₹18,000 crore, Housing and Urban Affairs Minister of State, Kaushal Kishore, informed the Rajya Sabha. The housing stock is lying unsold since 2014 as small flats located in the Narela area are deemed to be too costly and lack Metro connectivity, Kishore stated.

47.title: 10 villa owners booked for illegal rentals in Pune's Lonavala
47.article_body: Pune's Lonavala police have booked 10 villa owners between July 29 and July 31 for allegedly illegally renting their properties to tourists. The city's municipal council also urged owners to not rent villas without checking safety measures. "Our drive has intensified after...two recent deaths. Owners should either get requisite licence or stop renting villas and bungalows," an inspector said.

48.title: Terrorists hurl grenade at police post in J&K's Ramban
48.article_body: Terrorists hurled a grenade at a police post in the Gool area of Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban district on Tuesday, said officials. The grenade exploded on the roof of the police post, however, no injuries were reported. Jammu Kashmir Ghaznavi Force (JKGF), an offshoot of Lashkar-e-Taiba, has claimed responsibility for the attack in a letter, said ADGP Mukesh Singh.

49.title: California declares state of emergency over monkeypox outbreak
49.article_body: California has declared a state of emergency due to the spread of monkeypox in a bid to escalate efforts to combat the outbreak. Emergency medical officials will be allowed to administer monkeypox vaccines approved by the federal government. Last week, the state expanded its testing capacity to carry out more than 1,000 tests a week.

50.title: Russian action at Ukraine's nuclear plant risks terrible accident: US
50.article_body: The US has accused Russia of using Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant as a 'nuclear shield' and risking a terrible nuclear accident. US said that Russia has stationed troops near Zaporizhzhia plant, Ukraine's biggest nuclear power plant, and preventing Ukrainian forces from returning fire. In March, Russia was accused of firing shells dangerously close to the nuclear power plant.

51.title: US might control export of its chipmaking equipment to China: Report
51.article_body: US might limit shipment of American chipmaking equipment to Chinese memory chip makers with an aim to stop China's semiconductor sector advances, reports said. US might ban the export of tools to China used to make NAND chips. If amended, this would be first US step to target China's production of memory chips without specialised military apps through export controls.

52.title: Arvind Kejriwal promises free education and jobs in Gujarat
52.article_body: AAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Monday criticised BJP over unemployment and hooch tragedies in Gujarat. "I appeal to the people to choose AAP if you want free quality education and employment for your youth. You may vote for the BJP if you wish to feed them spurious liquor," said Kejriwal. He also promised unemployment allowance if AAP wins the polls.

53.title: Reduce fossil fuel use, adopt green energy for public transport: Gadkari
53.article_body: Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari stressed on the need to reduce fossil fuel consumption and adopt green energy for public transport and said the fare in electric buses can be 30% less than diesel ones. "Need to change country's transport system...Instead of petrol and diesel, we should focus on cheaper options like electricity, green hydrogen, ethanol and Bio-CNG," Gadkari added.

54.title: ED searches newspaper head office in Delhi in National Herald case
54.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday conducted searches at multiple places, including Herald House on Delhi's Bahadur Shah Zafar Marg, reports said. The searches were conducted in connection with ED's probe into the National Herald case under sections of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA). Searches were conducted days after Congress President Sonia Gandhi was questioned in case.

55.title: Law student stabs classmate over love triangle in Lucknow university
55.article_body: A law student stabbed his classmate multiple times with a machete over an alleged love triangle at a private university in Lucknow. The victim suffered injuries around his neck, head and hands and has undergone multiple surgeries. The victim and accused had a fight a few days ago over a girl in their class. The accused is in custody.

56.title: Delhi's 1st monkeypox patient discharged: LNJP Hospital MD
56.article_body: Delhi's first monkeypox patient has been successfully discharged, Suresh Kumar, the Medical Director (MD) of the national capital's LNJP Hospital, said on Tuesday. He added that the man, who had no history of foreign travel, recovered in 25 days as "all symptoms waned away". This comes a day after a second monkeypox case was reported in Delhi.

57.title: Productivity at Google is not where it needs to be, there are real concerns: CEO
57.article_body: Google CEO Sundar Pichai at a recent all-hands meeting said, "There are real concerns that our productivity...is not where it needs to be for the headcount we have." Pichai asked employees to help "create a culture that is more mission-focused", CNBC reported. "We should think about how we can minimise distractions and really raise the bar on...productivity," he added.

58.title: Afghanistan needs India's help desperately: Taliban
58.article_body: Taliban militant Sirajuddin Haqqani said that Afghanistan "desperately" needs India's help, adding that India has a name in technology and trust in the international community that it fulfils its promises. "India has historical ties with Afghanistan. India had started some research and developmental programmes in Afghanistan...We want the unfinished projects...be...completed," he added.

59.title: We should be little kind to Hindi films: Alia on North vs South debate
59.article_body: Reacting to the North vs South debate, actress Alia Bhatt has said that it has been a tough year for Indian cinema. "We should be a little kind to Hindi films...Even in the South industry, all their films have not worked [this year]," she added. Alia further stated that a film with good content "always" does well.

60.title: Beyoncé to remove ableist lyric from new song 'Heated' amid backlash
60.article_body: Singer-songwriter Beyoncé has confirmed that she will change the lyrics of her new song 'Heated' which were called ableist and offensive by disability activists. The lyrics, co-written by Canadian singer Drake, have the line, "Spazzin' on that a**, spazz on that a**." "The word, not used intentionally in a harmful way, will be replaced," her statement read.

61.title: SC imposes ₹5 lakh fine on NGO over Noida's twin towers' petition
61.article_body: The Supreme Court asked an NGO to pay ₹5 lakh fine for filing a PIL seeking alteration of its year-old judgement directing demolition of Supertech twin towers in Noida Sector 93A. The petition urged court to utilise the 40-storey towers for some "national cause" instead of demolishing. The court asked the petitioner to deposit the amount within four weeks.

62.title: Water supply in parts of Pune to be shut off on Thursday
62.article_body: The water supply in parts of Pune will remain shut off on Thursday due to maintenance and repair work at the Parvati and Lashkar water stations. The water supply on Friday will be low pressure and delayed, Pune Municipal Corporation officials said. The areas which will get affected include Dattawadi, Rajendra Nagar, Mula Road, Koregaon Park, Wanawadi and others.

63.title: K'taka HC issues notices to Centre, state over detention of Sri Lankan citizens
63.article_body: Karnataka High Court has issued notices to the union and state governments over the alleged detention of Sri Lankan citizens in Bangalore Central Jail in Parappana Agrahara. A PIL has been filed on behalf of 25 persons claiming that the detention is illegal and a violation of human rights. It also seeks the transfer of the accused to detention centres.

64.title: Russia seeks to ban 'unfriendly' nations from adopting Russian children
64.article_body: Russian lawmakers on Monday tabled a bill in the lower house of the Parliament to ban the adoption of Russian children by citizens of "unfriendly" countries. If passed, the bill would expand a 2012 law that prohibits US citizens from adopting Russian children. Russia's list of unfriendly countries was expanded after several nations imposed sanctions on Moscow over Ukraine invasion.

65.title: Circulation of fake ₹2,000 notes decreased in banking system from 2018-19: Govt
65.article_body: The Union Ministry of Finance told Lok Sabha that circulation of fake ₹2,000 denomination currency notes has decreased in banking system from 2018-19. "In 2021-22, the number of fake currency notes of ₹2,000 denomination detected in banking system was 13,604 pieces which is 0.000635% of total number of banknotes of ₹2,000 denomination in circulation," MoS for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said.

66.title: Another monkeypox case reported in Kerala, India's tally reaches 7
66.article_body: Kerala Health Minister Veena George on Tuesday informed that another monkeypox case was reported in the state, making it the fifth case in the state and seventh in India. The patient is a 30-year-old man who reached Kozhikode airport from UAE on July 27 and is currently undergoing treatment in Malappuram. Other two cases of monkeypox were reported in Delhi.

67.title: 2 women try to sell newborn girl for ₹4.5 lakh in Mumbai; arrested
67.article_body: A 35-year-old woman and her associate were arrested for allegedly trying to sell a 15-day-old baby girl for ₹4.5 lakh in Mumbai. A member of Central Adoption Resources Authority received a tip-off about a woman who was looking for a buyer for the baby. He along with police tricked her into selling the babygirl to him and caught her red-handed.

68.title: Oil extends losses amid global demand concerns, manufacturing data
68.article_body: Oil prices on Tuesday extended the losses from the previous session with Brent crude futures falling 29 cents to $99.74 a barrel and WTI crude futures down 22 cents at $93.67 a barrel. The slide was driven by global oil demand concerns after weak manufacturing data in several countries. The Brent futures settled at $100.03 a barrel on Monday.

69.title: Murder accused ex-Army man, who acted in 28 films while hiding for 30 years, held
69.article_body: A murder accused, identified as Omprakash alias Pasha who earlier worked in the Indian Army's Signals Corps, has been arrested after 30 years. Pasha and his partner were booked in 1992 for allegedly stabbing to death a motorcyclist during a looting bid in Haryana. After the murder, Pasha started doing odd jobs, including acting in 28 regional and Bhojpuri films.

70.title: Maruti Suzuki India reports 8.2% increase in sales in July
70.article_body: Maruti Suzuki India on Monday reported an increase of 8.28% in total sales to 1,75,916 units in July 2022 against 1,62,462 units in the corresponding period last fiscal. Domestic passenger vehicle sales rose by 6.82% to 1,42,850 units, the carmaker said, adding that the shortage of electronic components had a slight impact on the production of vehicles.

71.title: 'Tiranga bike rally' for all MPs to be oraganised in Delhi tomorrow
71.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi said on Tuesday that the Culture Ministry is organising a 'Tiranga bike rally' for MPs of all political parties from Red Fort to the Parliament in Delhi tomorrow. He also urged all the MPs to join the rally at 8.30 am and stressed that the rally was organised by the ministry and not the BJP.

72.title: If you're not here to entertain me, go away: Kajol writes on Instagram
72.article_body: Actress Kajol recently took to Instagram Stories to share a seemingly angry and cryptic note. She wrote, "If you're not here to entertain me please go away and come back when you have some new material." This comes after Kajol marked 30 years in the film industry and shared a video montage of stills from her most notable projects.

73.title: Justin Bieber resumes world tour month after Ramsay Hunt Syndrome diagnosis
73.article_body: Singer Justin Bieber resumed his Justice world tour slightly over a month after his Ramsay Hunt Syndrome diagnosis. He shared pictures and videos from his performance in Italy at the Lucca Summer Festival on social media, writing, "Luv u guys and I missed you." Justin will be travelling to over 30 countries as part of his tour including India.

74.title: It took time to convince Harjinder to become a weightlifter: Coach
74.article_body: Talking about Indian weightlifter Harjinder Kaur who won a bronze medal at CWG 2022, her coach Paramjeet Sharma said, "It took some time to convince her to shift to weightlifting." "Sometimes Harjinder got carried away because of her own power," he added. Harjinder had earlier shared that the fodder she cut on a toka helped her build strong arms.

75.title: Not my money, was kept in my absence: Arpita on seized ₹50 crore
75.article_body: While reacting to the huge amount of cash seized from her flats, Arpita Mukherjee, ex-West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee's aide, on Tuesday said, "The money doesn't belong to me, it was kept there in my absence." Around ₹50 crore cash and jewellery were recovered from Mukherjee's two houses. Earlier, Chatterjee said the money doesn’t belong to him.

76.title: US used missile with 6 blades that slice through target to kill al-Qaeda chief: Reports
76.article_body: The US' Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) used the Hellfire R9X missile to eliminate al-Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri, according to reports. Hellfire R9X is said to be a warhead-less missile equipped with six razor-like blades extending from the fuselage that slices through its target but does not explode. The missile has never been publicly acknowledged by the Pentagon or CIA.

77.title: Our weightlifting contingent has performed exceptionally well at CWG 2022: PM Modi
77.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has congratulated weightlifter Harjinder Kaur for winning the bronze medal in the women's 71-kg category at the CWG 2022. "Our weightlifting contingent has performed exceptionally well [in] Birmingham...Continuing this, Harjinder [has won] a bronze," wrote PM Modi. Notably, out of India's nine medals at CWG 2022 so far, seven have come from weightlifting.

78.title: Kohli will remain in his original no. 3 place: Jaffer on T20 WC
78.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said Virat Kohli should remain at his "original" number three spot in India's playing XI at the 2022 T20 World Cup. He added, "Rahul and Rohit should open...the aggressive approach that India has undertaken is very nice to witness. India's chances of winning (the WC) are bright." Kohli has been rested for the WI tour.

79.title: Ex-Sri Lankan Prez Gotabaya not getting any privileges: Singapore
79.article_body: Singapore Foreign Affairs Minister Vivian Balakrishnan said that former Sri Lanka President Gotabaya Rajapaksa was not being accorded any privileges or immunity in Singapore. Rajapaksa fled Sri Lanka along with his wife on July 13 amid mass protests over his alleged mismanagement of the country's economy. He resigned as President after arriving in Singapore from the Maldives on July 14.

80.title: He needs no advice, he's magic & magician put together: Alia on SRK's flops
80.article_body: When asked what advice would she give to actor Shah Rukh Khan after few of his films flopped at the box office, actress Alia Bhatt said that he needs no advice. "He's the magic and magician put together. So I won't give any advice to him, rather I'll take advice from him on how magical he is," she added.

81.title: Reviving theatres not in our hand, viewers also responsible: Sudeep
81.article_body: Actor Kiccha Sudeep, while reacting to shutting down of single-screen theatres in Karnataka, said reviving them is not in the industry's hand. "Reviving cannot happen with only one-hand clapping. One hand being...film industry...and...one big hand which can clap together, are...viewers," Sudeep said. He added people don't go to theatres thinking films will release on OTT platforms after some time.

82.title: Meeting Big B for 1st time was like meeting God, I was dumbstruck: KBC director
82.article_body: 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' director Arun Sheshkumar said that meeting actor Amitabh Bachchan for the first time was like meeting his God. "On October 11 every year, I would go and stand in front of his bungalow. The first time I met him, I was dumbstruck. He must have found me to be a low-confident guy," he added.

83.title: Don’t be brutal, time keeps changing for all: Uddhav Thackeray to BJP
83.article_body: Reacting to JP Nadda's statement that BJP would annihilate all regional parties and Shiv Sena was about to get finished in Maharashtra, Uddhav Thackeray said BJP shouldn't be so drunk on power. "Time keeps changing for everyone. You get back everything bad you do to others," he said. "BJP plot means dividing Hindus, crushing nativist and regional pride," he added.

84.title: Over 1,500 cattle die in Gujarat as lumpy skin disease affects multiple districts
84.article_body: The cattle death toll due to lumpy skin disease in Gujarat has reached 1,565, the state government said on Monday. The disease has spread in 2,083 villages across 20 districts and about 55,950 animals have been infected by the disease that spreads in cattle through blood-feeding insects. Mundra and Mandvi taluka are worst hit areas, a Gujarat Congress leader said.

85.title: IMD issues red alert for 10 districts in Kerala for today amid heavy rains
85.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued a 'red' alert for 10 districts in Kerala for today amid heavy rains in the state. The 'red' alert has been issued in all districts except Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Pathanamthitta and Kasargod, where an 'orange' alert has been sounded for Tuesday and Wednesday. CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Monday said six people have died amid heavy rains.

86.title: Was told 'You're too good looking,' star kids taken over looks: Karan Tacker
86.article_body: Television actor Karan Tacker has stated that he has faced rejection in the industry over superficial things like being "too good looking" and was told, "Don't be so fit". He called it hypocritical, saying that star kids are launched over their physicality. "Even with the best bodies, they will be playing roles that do not require bodies," the actor added.

87.title: Gogi gang sharpshooter arrested after encounter with police in Delhi
87.article_body: Delhi Police's Special Cell arrested an alleged sharpshooter belonging to Gogi gang following an encounter near Bhalswa Dairy in Delhi, police said on Monday. The accused, Bhagwan Singh, also used to work for Lawrence Bishnoi who is accused in the murder of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala, police added. Singh was injured in his left leg during the encounter.

88.title: 80 men arrested for gangraping 8 models shooting a music video in South Africa
88.article_body: More than 80 men suspected of gangraping eight models and armed robbery of a video production crew in the South African town of Krugersdorp were produced in court on Monday. "The crew of 12 women and 10 men were busy filming a music video when they were allegedly attacked by a group of armed men clad in blankets," police said.

89.title: Jaimangal was regularly meeting Assam CM, allegations false: BJP's Hazarika
89.article_body: Assam Minister Pijush Hazarika said that Congress MLA Kumar Jaimangal is making fake allegations that three arrested MLAs had lured him to meet Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma. Sharing pictures of Jaimangal with the Assam CM and Union Minister Pralhad Joshi, Hazarika said that Jaimangal has been constantly meeting Assam CM and met him five days before filing "fabricated FIR".

90.title: My films come after 4 yrs, trade changes in that time; I'm concerned: Aamir
90.article_body: Actor Aamir khan said that he is concerned because his movies release after four years. "Trade always changes in these four years. Don't know what will happen when my next film releases," he said, adding that films come on OTT platforms very fast. "I have always tried to keep a six months gap, at least for my films," he added.

91.title: Arsenic found in groundwater in 209 districts, uranium in 152: Govt
91.article_body: Arsenic has been found in the groundwater in parts of 209 districts in 25 states and Union Territories, Minister of State for Jal Shakti, Bishweswar Tudu, informed the Rajya Sabha on Monday. Uranium has been found in parts of 152 districts in 18 states, he added. Lead has been found in parts of 176 districts in 21 states, Tudu stated.

92.title: Indian cyclist Ronaldo finishes 12th in men's 1000m time trial final at CWG 2022
92.article_body: Indian cyclist Ronaldo Laitonjam finished 12th in the men's 1000m time trial final at the Commonwealth Games 2022 on Monday. Ronaldo, who clocked 1:02.500 in the event, was 2.995 seconds behind gold medallist Matthew Glaetzer, who clocked 59.505. Ronaldo had earlier lost to Glaetzer in the pre-quarterfinals of the men's sprint event.

93.title: BJP seems unaffected by inflation, they’re thick-skinned people: Kharge
93.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Tuesday said that when people across India are affected by inflation, BJP seems to be unaffected by it. "They are thick-skinned people," Kharge added. "We are ready to discuss the issue of price rise and have a consensus among us to keep the issue of inflation in the House," he stated.

94.title: MP Mahua keeps her ₹1.5 lakh Louis Vuitton bag down amid inflation debate in Lok Sabha
94.article_body: A video being widely circulated on social media showed TMC MP Mahua Moitra keeping her bag down, moving it from beside her to near her feet, once TMC member Kakoli Ghosh Dastidar raised the issue of inflation in Lok Sabha on Monday. As per reports, it was a Louis Vuitton bag priced at more than ₹1.5 lakh.

95.title: Rahul known for shallow politics, doesn't have serious knowledge of topics: Patra
95.article_body: BJP leader Sambit Patra on Monday said Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is known for "shallow politics". "You are never serious about politics. You don't have serious knowledge of topics," Patra added. His statement came after Rahul Gandhi criticised the government over the recovery of drugs at Gujarat's Mundra port. Unlike in past, drug smuggling doesn't go undetected now, Patra stated.

96.title: Dia Mirza pens note for 25-year-old niece who died in car accident in Hyderabad
96.article_body: Dia Mirza has penned a note for her niece, Tanya Kakde, who died at the age of 25 in a car accident near Hyderabad on Monday. Dia wrote, "My niece. My child. My jaan. Gone into the light. May you find peace and love wherever you are my darling." She added, "You always brought a smile to our hearts...Om Shanti."

97.title: 3-month-old boy dies after vaccination in Odisha; case filed
97.article_body: A case has been filed after a three-month-old boy died last week after he was allegedly administered a faulty vaccine in Odisha's Jajpur, according to police. As per the complaint, the boy started crying uncontrollably and developed high fever after getting the vaccine and a pulse polio drop. The baby's body was exhumed and sent for autopsy, an inspector said.

98.title: Nothing to hide: Zomato CEO on Blinkit Founder's relationship with its executive
98.article_body: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal said there was "nothing to hide" about the relationship between its Chief People Officer Akriti Chopra and Blinkit Founder Albinder Dhindsa. The board was aware of it and Akriti was never involved in discussions relating to the ₹4,447-crore acquisition of Blinkit, Goyal explained. Earlier, Zomato was criticised for not disclosing that the two executives are married.

99.title: Zomato shares jump nearly 18% after June quarter earnings
99.article_body: Zomato's share price surged around 18% in Tuesday’s early trade after the company came out with its June quarter earnings on Monday. The stock gained 18.44% to hit ₹54.90 apiece against its previous close of ₹46.35 on BSE. Zomato reported a net loss of ₹186 crore for the June quarter against a net loss of ₹356 crore a year ago.

100.title: Rapper Drake tests +ve for COVID, postpones Young Money Reunion show
100.article_body: Taking to Instagram Stories, rapper Drake has revealed that he has tested positive for COVID-19. He further wrote, "The Young Money Reunion show is being rescheduled to the SOONEST date possible." "I'm...sorry for letting you down on our weekend together and the moment I test negative, I will give you everything I got on stage (except COVID-19)," he added.

101.title: Family carries woman's body on cot for post-mortem in MP
101.article_body: A tribal woman's body was carried on a cot by her family to take it for post-mortem reportedly due to the absence of a hearse vehicle from the government in the Kehraha Tola area in Madhya Pradesh's Singrauli. A police station in-charge said that the incident occurred as the area where the woman died is inaccessible to vehicles.

102.title: 3 youths molest woman for not giving way to their car in Pune; arrested
102.article_body: Three college students were arrested for allegedly molesting a woman during a road rage incident in Pune's Bavdhan on Sunday. The youths reportedly got angry as the woman didn't give way to their car despite them honking loudly, following which an argument broke out between them. They reportedly intercepted her vehicle and thrashed and molested the woman during the scuffle.

103.title: BMC to set up 3 new parking lots to decongest South Mumbai
103.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is planning to set up parking facilities in three locations in South Mumbai to decongest these areas, a civic official said. The civic body has floated a tender for construction and maintenance of underground electro-mechanical car parking in the Fort area and two other robotic parking towers at Zaveri Bazaar and Matunga.

104.title: India likely to receive normal monsoon rains in August, September: IMD
104.article_body: The second half of southwest monsoon, from August to September is most likely to be normal for the country as a whole, IMD said on Monday. "Some deficiency may remain in Bihar, some northeastern states and other parts of the Indo-Gangetic plains," M Mohapatra, DG, IMD, said. "Above normal or excess rains are not expected for the region," Mohapatra added.

105.title: People say 'Are you PMSing?' To hell with you: Alia on sexism
105.article_body: Speaking about sexism, actress Alia Bhatt has stated that people say things like, 'Don't be so sensitive' and 'Are you PMSing?' "To hell with you, I am not being sensitive...You were born because women were PMSing," the actress added. She further stated that there is a certain understanding of how you should hide a lot of things as a woman.

106.title: Only similarity between 'Laal...' and 'PK' is innocence: Aamir Khan
106.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan has stated that the only similarity between his upcoming film 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and 2014 film 'PK' is the innocence of the lead characters. "The difference...you will see in the whole performance," the actor added. Earlier, social media users had pointed out similarities between the two films after watching the trailer of 'Laal Singh Chaddha'.

107.title: We'll only make 'Gorkha' when we're 100% right with the subject: Aanand
107.article_body: Speaking about 'Gorkha', filmmaker Aanand L Rai has said, "We'll only make the film when we feel that we are 100% right with the subject and we've cracked it well." The film was announced in October last year and will feature actor Akshay Kumar. "We're finding the right bound script and the process is on as we speak," he stated.

108.title: Pune girl slips, fractures leg at Kataldhar Waterfall; rescued
108.article_body: A female trekker from Pune was rescued after she slipped on a rock and fractured her leg at Kataldhar Waterfall in Lonavala. Another trekker had contacted the Shivdurg rescue team when the girl got injured. The rescue team reached the spot within one and a half hours and gave the girl first aid. The incident took place on Sunday.

109.title: A step towards a safer world: Trudeau on al-Qaeda chief's killing
109.article_body:
Canadian PM Justin Trudeau said the death of al-Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri is a 
"step towards a safer world". "Canada will keep working with our global partners to counter terrorist threats, promote peace and security, and keep people here at home and around the world safe," Trudeau added. The al-Qaeda chief was killed in a US drone strike in Afghanistan.

110.title: Don't think we have many films like 'Raksha...' in B'wood: Akshay Kumar
110.article_body: Speaking about his upcoming film 'Raksha Bandhan', actor Akshay Kumar has said that he has played many different roles in his career, however, he has never played a role that focuses on the sister-brother bond. "Actually, I don't think we have many such films in our industry. So in that sense, I got to try something new," he further added.

111.title: If you don't give opportunity, they'll never know: Rohit on Avesh bowling final over
111.article_body: Talking about Avesh Khan bowling the final over in the second T20I when WI needed 10 runs to win and Bhuvneshwar Kumar had two overs left, India captain Rohit Sharma said, "It's all about giving opportunity." He added, "If you don't give opportunity to Avesh or Arshdeep, [they'll] never know what it is to bowl at death for India."

112.title: ITC Q1 net profit up 34% to ₹4,389.8 crore, revenue rises 39.2%
112.article_body: ITC Limited on Monday reported a 33.9% surge in consolidated net profit to ₹4,389.76 crore for the quarter ended June. Its revenue from operations during the said quarter rose 39.25% to ₹19,831.31 crore as against ₹14,240.76 crore a year ago. "Economic activity during the quarter gathered further momentum with an uptick in business and consumer sentiments," the Kolkata-headquartered company said.

113.title: I was made to feel worthless when I work my a** off: Janhvi on nepotism
113.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has stated that she was made to feel worthless because she got opportunities in the film industry due to her parents Boney Kapoor and Sridevi. "I work my a** off to give it back to them for what they have done for me," the actress added. She further said that she feels overwhelming respect for her parents.

114.title: Heard explosion, people couldn't find way out: Hospital guard on MP fire
114.article_body: While talking about a fire that broke out at a private hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur on Monday, Ramkumar Patel, a security guard outside the New Life Multi-speciality Hospital near Damoh Naka, said that the fire started small but there was a "loud explosion". "Many people could not find a way out and died," Patel added.

115.title: Cricket betting racket busted in Hyderabad, over ₹5 lakh cash seized
115.article_body: The Hyderabad City Police on Monday busted a cricket betting racket and seized ₹5,91,820 in cash. Acting on a tip-off, a police team led by Inspector S Raghavendra raided a flat in Sulthan Bazar and arrested two accused persons who organised the racket and collected money from punters. According to police, one more suspect in the case is still absconding.

116.title: Assam to provide digital caste certificates to students
116.article_body: Assam government has launched ‘Mission Bhumiputra’, which aims to issue digital caste certificates to students across the state. The certificates will be available in the DigiLocker under the IT Act. CM Himanta Biswa Sarma inaugurated the Bhumiputra portal at a programme and lauded the mission. “Manual system of issuing caste certificates will be discontinued in Assam,” said Sarma.

117.title: Pune civic body to supply water via tankers for areas facing shortage
117.article_body: As the Baner, Balewadi, Pashan, Sus and Mahalunge areas in Pune are facing water supply problems, the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to supply water in these areas using tankers until the supply problem is solved. "There has been sufficient storage in the dams...but improper planning of water distribution...has created water woes," former BJP corporator Amol Balwadkar said.

118.title: 1 man killed, 5 more wounded in shooting at apartment complex in US
118.article_body: One man was killed and five others were wounded in a shooting at an apartment complex in Northeast Washington on Monday night, the Metropolitan Police Department said. All the victims were adult males and those wounded were being treated at area hospitals. The circumstances of the shooting, including if the victims knew each other, were being investigated, police said.

119.title: France-based app developers sue Apple over app store fees
119.article_body: French app developers sued Apple on Monday accusing the latter of violating US antitrust law by overcharging them to use its app store. The complaint filed in a US court said that the iPhone maker abused its market monopoly over app distribution on iOS-based mobile devices by authorising only one app store. Apple is yet to comment on this.

120.title: Completely normal: Elon Musk's father on having 2 kids with his stepdaughter
120.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk's father Errol in an interview said that it was "completely normal" for him to have two children with his 35-year-old stepdaughter, Jana Bezuidenhout. He also reiterated, "The only thing we are on Earth for is to reproduce." Errol has a five-year-old son with Jana and had welcomed a daughter in 2019.

121.title: PM Modi changes display pic on social media to Tricolour, asks Indians to do the same
121.article_body: Ahead of the Independence Day, PM Narendra Modi changed the display picture on his social media accounts to Tricolour and urged all the Indians to do the same. "It's a special 2nd August today! At a time when we're marking Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav, our nation is all set for #HarGharTiranga, a collective movement to celebrate our Tricolour," he said.

122.title: BJP’s nefarious intentions to topple my govt have failed: J'khand CM
122.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren said that BJP’s "nefarious intentions" to topple his government have failed. "We saw another example of BJP’s hunger for power...This is a big attack on our country’s democracy. Nor was I unsettled by their acts earlier, neither I am today," Soren added. Earlier, three Jharkhand MLAs were caught with huge amount of cash in West Bengal.

123.title: MSRTC to introduce around 100 AC electric buses on Mumbai-Pune route
123.article_body: The Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) has decided to introduce around 100 new air-conditioned electric buses on Mumbai-Pune route by end of this year, an official of MSRTC said. These e-buses will have a seating capacity of 45 passengers and facilities like mobile charging sockets, emergency buttons, etc. The cost of one electric bus is approximately ₹1.6 crore.

124.title: T'gana woman throws daughter in water sump, pretends robbers killed her
124.article_body: A woman in Telangana's Jangaon reportedly threw her one-year-old daughter in a water sump and pretended that a chain-snatcher killed her. She was picked up by the police on suspicion of killing the child hours after she claimed that a man threw the baby in the sump after she resisted a robbery attempt. She later reportedly confessed to her crime.

125.title: Raj HC judgment on parole for having baby cannot be precedent: SC
125.article_body: The Supreme Court has stated that Rajasthan High Court granting parole to a convict for fathering a child cannot be cited as a precedent. The apex court was hearing the Rajasthan government's plea challenging HC's order and refused to intervene. However, it maintained that state governments and jail authorities can raise objections if any other convict seeks the same liberty.

126.title: 26-year-old crashes into car’s open door in Punjab, dies after truck hits him
126.article_body: A 26-year-old man died after being run over by a truck after his bike crashed into a car's open door in Punjab's Landran on Sunday evening. The deceased, Manjit Singh, and his injured co-worker Vikram Singh were on their way home after finishing their shift at an automobile service station in Landran when the incident took place.

127.title: Man lynched over suspicion of cattle theft in Bihar's Samastipur
127.article_body: A Begusarai resident, Mushtakeen, was reportedly lynched by a mob over suspicion of cattle theft in Bihar's Samastipur on the intervening night of Sunday-Monday. According to locals, three people were trying to steal oxen. They said that while two of them managed to escape, one was caught and killed by the mob, a video of which surfaced on social media.

128.title: Harshal Patel ruled out of 3rd T20I vs WI due to a rib injury
128.article_body: Team India pacer Harshal Patel has been ruled out of the third T20I against West Indies due to a rib injury. Harshal was also not available for selection in the second T20I, which India lost by five wickets. Leg-spinner Ravi Bishnoi was dropped to include Avesh Khan in the second T20I. The third T20I will be played today.

129.title: Raj reports 1st suspected monkeypox case, patient admitted to Jaipur hospital
129.article_body: Rajasthan has reported its first suspected case of monkeypox after a 20-year-old, showing symptoms of the virus, was admitted to a government hospital in Jaipur. His samples have been sent to Pune's National Institute of Virology, an official said. The suspected monkeypox patient has been suffering from fever for four days and has rashes on his body, the official added.

130.title: Chhattisgarh's Chandkhuri, Giraudpuri and Sonakhan to be renamed
130.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel has instructed renaming of three places of historical significance in the state. The names of Chandkhuri, Giraudpuri and Sonakhan will be changed. Chandkhuri will be known as Mata Kaushalya Dham Chandkhuri, Giraudpuri will be renamed as Baba Guru Ghasidas Dham Giraudpuri and Sonakhan will be called Shaheed Veer Narayan Singh Dham Sonakhan.

131.title: Ram Gopal Yadav meets Yogi, SP says discussed minority issues
131.article_body: Samajwadi Party leader and Rajya Sabha MP Ram Gopal Yadav met UP CM Yogi Adityanath at his residence in Lucknow on Monday. The meeting reportedly lasted for about half-an-hour. In a tweet after the meeting, SP said, "Talks were held in the context of persecution of backwards and Muslims across the state by filing false cases unilaterally."

132.title: Man with loaded AK-47 arrested outside Iranian journalist's US home
132.article_body: A man with a loaded AK-47 rifle was arrested outside the New York City home of an Iranian-American journalist who has been critical of Iran's regime. Masih Alinejad, who was the target of an alleged Tehran-backed kidnapping plot last year, said the Iranian government sent the man and is targeting her for giving voice to those being oppressed in Iran.

133.title: FBI releases 'deceased' poster of al-Qaeda chief who had $25 mn bounty on his head
133.article_body: The FBI has added 'deceased' caption under the profile picture of Ayman al-Zawahiri on its website and released an updated poster, after the Al-Qaeda chief was killed by the US in a drone strike in Kabul. The poster states that under the Rewards For Justice Program, al-Zawahiri had $25 million bounty on his head.

134.title: We'll start shooting 'Pushpa 2' after strike in Telugu industry ends: Producer
134.article_body: 'Pushpa: The Rise' producer Y Ravi Shankar opened up about the shoot of the 2021 film's sequel. "We have a strike going on here in the Telugu industry. Once the strike is over, we'll start from August-end or whenever the strike is over," he said. Shankar further added that they are ready to shoot the Allu Arjun-starrer.

135.title: Indiscipline can't be excused: Rasquinha on India's 4-4 draw vs Eng at CWG
135.article_body: Discussing the 4-4 draw between the Indian men's hockey team and England at CWG 2022, ex-Indian men's hockey team captain Viren Rasquinha tweeted there were "harsh" umpiring decisions against the former. Rasquinha however added the indiscipline which led to three cards for the Indian team was "inexcusable". "Letting a 4-1 lead...slip in the final quarter...[was] poor [by India]," he stated.

136.title: One of my bigger problems was adjusting to India: 'Decoupled' actress Sonia
136.article_body: Actress Sonia Rathee, who starred in 'Decoupled' and 'Broken But Beautiful 3', said one of her bigger problems was adjusting to India. "I spent my entire life in California and then...New York. So just coming here...understanding the way people worked, how Mumbai worked especially...was kind of my biggest challenge," she said, adding, "Now it has kind of become my home."

137.title: Oppn looking for 'mehengai' but it's not there: BJP's Jayant Sinha
137.article_body: BJP leader Jayant Sinha on Monday said there is no "mehengai" (inflation) and the Opposition has been looking for it but is unable to find it. "Look at it from the point of view of a common person, we have filled the 'thali' of the common person," Sinha added. "People are not feeling inflation because of PM's foresightedness," he stated.

138.title: 9 children die due to diarrhoea outbreak in Arunachal's Tirap
138.article_body: At least nine children, aged between three and 10, have died due to a diarrhoea outbreak in Arunachal Pradesh's Tirap in the last two weeks, officials said. The District Medical Officer said that the reason for the diarrhoea outbreak is yet to be ascertained. A medical team and an ambulance have been kept on standby at a community hall.

139.title: Couple solves 1.5L+ genetic hair fall cases with 93% success: Traya
139.article_body: Traya revealed that it has found a breakthrough in managing genetic hair fall. By combining tenets of Ayurveda, dermatology, and nutrition, the brand customizes a regime that aims to target factors like stress, sleep, poor nutrition, digestion which speed up balding. Users can take an online test to help them identify the cause of hair fall and treat it accordingly.

140.title: BJP is like fish out of water when not in power: Jharkhand CM
140.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren accused BJP of trying to destabilise his government, saying that BJP is like "fish out of water" when not in power. Examples of non BJP-ruled states are in front of you, he added. His statement comes after three Jharkhand Congress MLAs were arrested in West Bengal after unaccounted cash worth lakhs was recovered from them.

141.title: Sensex falls 171.8 points, Nifty down to 17,271 in opening trade
141.article_body: The benchmark indices opened marginally lower on Tuesday with the Sensex falling 171.83 points at 57,943.67, while the Nifty was down 68.50 points at 17,271.50. ITC, HUL, BPCL, Asian Paints were among the top Nifty gainers. Stocks of UPL, Eicher Motors, Hindalco Industries and Tata Steel slipped. The Nifty metal index lost 1% in opening trade.

142.title: 1 dead, 5 policemen injured as MP minister's pilot vehicle collides with car
142.article_body: A 60-year-old man died and seven others, including five policemen, were injured when the pilot vehicle accompanying Madhya Pradesh minister Yashodhara Raje Scindia collided with a car in Shivpuri on Monday. The deceased was sitting under a tree when the accident took place. The incident occurred near the Kali Pahadi area, about 65 kilometres from the district headquarters.

143.title: India reports 13,734 new COVID-19 cases, 16.5% less than yesterday
143.article_body: India has reported 13,734 COVID-19 cases, 17,897 recoveries and 34 deaths in the last 24 hours including seven reconciled deaths in Kerala, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 16,464 cases and 39 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases stood at 1,39,792, while the death toll reached 5,26,430.

144.title: 3rd West Indies-India T20I to start at 9.30 pm tonight instead of 8 pm
144.article_body: The third West Indies-India T20I in St Kitts will begin at 9.30 pm (IST) tonight instead of 8 pm, Cricket West Indies announced. "Following the delayed start on Monday...the teams have agreed to start the third T20I at a later time to ensure the players receive adequate rest and recovery time for the back-to-back matches in St Kitts," it stated.

145.title: Zomato defends ₹4,447 cr acquisition of Blinkit, CEO says 'no skeletons in closet'
145.article_body: Zomato has defended its ₹4,447-crore acquisition of Blinkit, formerly Grofers. Addressing the criticism around the deal, Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal said, "We have zero skeletons in the closet." The deal was reached after an objective evaluation and Zomato "negotiated hard on valuation", he added. Goyal also said his relationship with Blinkit Founder Albinder Dhindsa was "actually a good thing".

146.title: It would be 'odd' if I star opposite SRK, Salman or Aamir: Janhvi
146.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said it would be a little "odd" if she stars opposite actors Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan or Aamir Khan, adding that she would love to work with them. Discussing her journey in Bollywood, Janhvi stated, "I have been made to feel that I...got things I don't deserve which means that I am technically worthless."

147.title: We want guys to be flexible: Rohit on different openers in T20Is
147.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma, on being asked about the frequent changes in batting positions of players, said that the team wants batters to be flexible. "We want the guys to be able to bat anywhere and don't want them to be batting in specific positions," he explained. In the two WI T20Is, Suryakumar Yadav has opened alongside Rohit.

148.title: He is well built but he's eating badly: Elon's father on his shirtless pics
148.article_body: Reacting to Elon Musk's shirtless photos from Mykonos, his father Errol remarked that while the former is well built, "he’s been eating badly". In an interview, Errol said he had tried to recommend weight-loss supplements to Elon. He added that he still thought of Elon as a "little boy", even though he was over 50 now and "an old man".

149.title: Delhi bars, restaurants refuse to serve liquor over excise license expiry
149.article_body: Delhi bars and restaurants refused to serve alcohol after their excise licenses expired on July 31 over the state's rollback of its November 2021 excise policy. A restauranteur stated they incurred a ₹1-1.25 lakh loss and lost visitors to Gurugram and Noida. Delhi Lt Governor approved the state government's one-month extension of excise licenses of private liquor vendors on Monday.

150.title: What's the logic: Aamir on criticism over Mona Singh playing his mother in 'Laal Singh...'
150.article_body: Aamir Khan reacted to criticism over 40-year-old Mona Singh playing the role of his mother in their upcoming film Laal Singh Chaddha. "What is the logic...It is the beauty of the actor to look any age on the screen despite their real age," Aamir said. "You are snatching away her good work. This is wrong," he added.

151.title: Cyclist Meenakshi gets run over by rival after high-speed crash at CWG, video surfaces
151.article_body: Indian cyclist Meenakshi was run over by New Zealand's Bryony Botha after a high-speed crash during the women's 10-km scratch race at CWG 2022. Meenakshi fell from her bike before sliding down the banking on the bend after which Botha ran over her. Meenakshi was stretchered off, while Botha also fell from her bike.

152.title: Yasin Malik ends hunger strike in Tihar Jail after 10 days
152.article_body: J&K separatist leader Yasin Malik, who was on hunger strike in Tihar Jail, discontinued his fasting after he was told that his demands have been forwarded to the authorities concerned. Malik went on an indefinite hunger strike after the Centre did not respond to his request to allow him to physically appear in a Jammu court for an abduction case.

153.title: 6 dead amid Kerala rains; CM says 'There could be crisis if heavy rainfall continues'
153.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Monday said that six people have died and one was missing amid heavy rains. "If this amount of rain continues...there could be a crisis," Vijayan added. As many as five houses have completely collapsed and 55 have partially collapsed. A 'red' alert has been issued for Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Pathanamthitta, Kottayam, Ernakulam and Idukki.

154.title: You won't okay first take, no: Chiranjeevi on Aamir's wish to do film with him
154.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan told actor Chiranjeevi he wants to do a movie with him. "Either I will direct or produce," Aamir said. "You won't okay the first take, no?" Chiranjeevi asked Khan, before also joking that he might end up giving 79 takes. Earlier, Khan had teased Chiranjeevi, saying he took actor Salman Khan for his film but not him.

155.title: Not happy with my performance: Harjinder after winning bronze at CWG
155.article_body: Following her bronze medal in the women's 71-kg category, Indian weightlifter Harjinder Kaur said she is "not happy" with her performance, though she is pleased about winning a medal. "I was confident...I will get a medal," she added. Harjinder's bronze medal has increased India's medal tally at CWG 2022 to nine. She lifted a total weight of 212 kg.

156.title: Our stand is nationalism, there's no question of discrimination: K'taka CM
156.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said BJP is a national party which emphasises upon nationalism. "There's no question of discrimination against anyone," he added. Bommai's remarks came after Congress and JD(S) targeted him for not visiting the homes of two Muslim men who were killed in Dakshina Kannada, even though he met the family of murdered BJP youth leader Praveen Nettaru.

157.title: Chandigarh constable suspended after hitting helmetless biker
157.article_body: A constable of Chandigarh Police was suspended on Monday after CCTV footage showed him hitting a biker riding without helmet with his baton. A video of the incident was widely circulated on social media. The complainant stated he was forced to tell doctors that he sustained his injuries after falling from his motorcycle when he was taken for medical examination.

158.title: Pak helicopter carrying Army General, other officers goes missing
158.article_body: A Pakistani military helicopter with six people on board, including an Army General, went missing on Monday, the army said. The helicopter was on a flood relief operation in Balochistan when it lost contact with air traffic control (ATC), it added. Calling the incident "alarming", PM Shehbaz Sharif said the entire nation is praying for the return of those onboard.

159.title: We nearly made a mess of this as well: Pooran after win in final over vs India
159.article_body: West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran said that "a win is a win" after they secured victory in the second T20I against India in the 20th over of their innings. "We lost a few close games and nearly made a mess of this as well," he stated. WI chased down India's 138-run total with only four balls remaining in the game.

160.title: Agra youth jumps into Yamuna river after failing to get govt job
160.article_body: A youth jumped into the Yamuna river after failing to secure a government job on Sunday night, police said. The man, who was a resident of Agra, was also preparing for army recruitment. Police stated that he left a note on his WhatsApp status before jumping into the river. A search is on to recover his body.

161.title: 2 people arrested for killing realtor in Hyderabad's Madhapur
161.article_body: The Cyberabad Police on Monday arrested two men who may have fired upon and killed realtor Mohammed Ismail in Hyderabad's Madhapur. The two, identified as Jilani and Feroz, were nabbed on the outskirts of Hyderabad. However, the prime accused in the case, Mujahid, is currently on the run. According to police, there were property disputes between the accused and deceased.

162.title: Leaders from rival group shouldn't play with Shiv Sainiks' sentiments: Anita Birje
162.article_body: Shiv Sena's newly appointed deputy leader Anita Birje on Monday said that leaders from the rival group should not play with the sentiments of Shiv Sainiks, who will rise to the occasion if anyone tries to do so. "We will follow the path set by late Shiv Sena supremo Balasaheb Thackeray, with 80% social work and 20% politics," Birje added.

163.title: 3 police officers threaten lawyer, extort ₹9 lakh in Gurugram; held
163.article_body: The Gurugram Police have arrested three police personnel, including a special police officer, for allegedly extorting ₹9 lakh from a lawyer, officials said. The complainant claimed that he was at a guest house when at least five people, including the police personnel, arrived there, took him hostage, threatened to lodge a false case against him and demanded money.

164.title: Mumbai's madrassa teacher sold stolen mobiles in Nepal, Bangladesh; held
164.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested a 32-year-old man who is one of the seven gang members involved in auctioning stolen mobiles to resellers from Nepal and Bangladesh after changing the IMEI numbers. The accused had a bank account in Nepal and used to work as an Urdu teacher at a madrassa in Kurla. He was part of 43 WhatsApp groups.

165.title: Elon Musk is planning to build his own private airport in Texas: Report
165.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk is reportedly planning to build his own private airport in Texas. As per the report, the airport will be used by Musk and his executives. Musk has based several of his companies, including SpaceX and The Boring Company, in Texas, and moved his Tesla headquarters from Silicon Valley to Texas in December.

166.title: Pelosi has right to visit Taiwan, China needn't turn it into a conflict: US
166.article_body: The White House has warned China against turning US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's potential visit to Taiwan into a "crisis or conflict", saying Pelosi "has the right to visit Taiwan". The White House also warned China might respond to Pelosi's mooted visit to Taiwan with military provocations, including by firing missiles near Taiwan. China claims Taiwan as its own territory.

167.title: Love it when people think 'She's so dumb', memes add to my popularity: Alia
167.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said that she loves it when people think that she is unintelligent or that "Oh, she is so dumb". "They make so many memes on me which add to [my] popularity...I also want to put out this message for young girls...general knowledge and bookish intelligence in my opinion is not intelligence," she added.

168.title: In-laws harass woman for not giving birth to boy in Pune; FIR filed
168.article_body: Pune's Chinchwad police have filed an FIR against a 28-year-old woman's in-laws for allegedly harassing and molesting her for not giving birth to a boy, officials said on Monday. The woman rushed to police to file a complaint following an incident on July 29, wherein she was apparently grabbed by her hair, beaten, verbally abused and molested by her in-laws.

169.title: I don't take this seriously: Kareena on 'Boycott Laal...' Twitter trend
169.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan has reacted to the Twitter trend calling for a boycott of her upcoming movie 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "Everyone has an opinion...if that is going to be there, then you have to learn to ignore certain things," she stated. Kareena added, "Otherwise, it'll...become impossible to live your life...that's why I don't take any of this like seriously."

170.title: I worked in many factories, tea stalls when I was young: Sudesh Lehri
170.article_body: Comedian Sudesh Lehri, recalling his childhood, revealed that he had circumstances when he was in poverty. "I used to work in small shops when I was young. I've worked in...many factories, tea stalls," he stated. Sudesh added he used to "quietly" have some tea before giving it to factory workers as there were days he couldn't have tea at home.

171.title: I've written to Tom Hanks if he's free & would watch 'Laal...': Aamir
171.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan revealed that he has written to Hollywood actor Tom Hanks if he would like to watch 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. The film is an official remake of Hanks' 'Forrest Gump'. "I've written to him if he's free...would like to watch the film. I have got feedback from his team that they're seeing his schedule for that," he stated.

172.title: Burglars drill hole in wall of jewellery shop in Pune, steal ornaments
172.article_body: Burglars stole gold ornaments worth ₹2.96 lakh by drilling a hole in the wall of a jewellery shop in Pune's Undri, police said. They entered the premises of a school, adjacent to the shop, and drilled a hole in the common wall, police added. The burglars also stole the digital video recorder in which the CCTV footage was captured.

173.title: Who was al Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri killed in US drone strike in Afghanistan?
173.article_body: Al Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri, 71, was a key architect behind multiple assaults on the US and was "deeply involved" in the planning of the September 11, 2001 attacks that killed 3,000 people. Born in 1951, he grew up in Egypt's upper-class neighbourhood. Zawahiri, a trained surgeon, became al Qaeda's leader after Osama bin Laden was killed in 2011.

174.title: Suryakumar, Avesh wear Arshdeep’s jersey in 2nd T20I against West Indies, pics go viral
174.article_body: India cricketers Suryakumar Yadav and Avesh Khan were seen wearing Arshdeep Singh's jersey during the second T20I against West Indies. This came after the match was postponed twice due to logistics issues, with luggage not arriving on time. Reacting to it, a fan wrote, "How many extra jerseys does he have?" Another tweet read, "Why are everyone wearing Arshdeep's jersey?"
