351.title: Heroin worth ₹8 crore seized in Assam, 2 arrested for drug peddling
351.article_body: Assam Police has arrested two persons on the charge of drug peddling after seizing heroin with an international value of ₹8 crore on Sunday, officials said. A joint team of the police and CRPF intercepted a vehicle following a tip-off and recovered around 75 boxes containing 966 grams of heroin. The accused were transporting the heroin from Dimapur to Guwahati.

352.title: Actress Pranitha Subhash reveals daughter's face, names her Arna
352.article_body: Actress Pranitha Subhash took to Instagram on Monday to share a post revealing the face of her daughter for the first time. "Introducing Arna," she wrote alongside the picture. Reacting to her post, a fan wrote, "Super cute. God bless little angel," while another commented, "Cuteness overloaded." Pranitha and her husband Nithin Raju welcomed Arna in June.

353.title: Rajasthan man beaten up by relatives, hands tied on suspicion of affair with widow
353.article_body: A 30-year-old man was allegedly beaten up by his relatives in Rajasthan’s Jhalawar on Saturday on suspicion of having an affair with a widow in the family, police said. The man was purportedly made to walk with his hands tied, the police added. Station House Officer (SHO), Guman Singh, said that the accused "wanted to teach him a lesson".

354.title: 4th Nigerian national arrested in 10 days in Pune for drug trafficking
354.article_body: Another Nigerian national, Okeke Infechukwu John (29), was arrested by the Pune Police for allegedly carrying out drug trafficking. John is the fourth Nigerian citizen to be arrested in the last 10 days in Pune for drug-related charges. Around 18 grams of cocaine worth over Rs 2.7 lakh and two bikes were seized from John, police said.

355.title: Dubai-bound man held with foreign currency worth ₹60 lakh at Delhi airport
355.article_body: A man has been arrested from Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport with foreign currency worth ₹60 lakh including 2,62,500 Saudi Riyal and 5,000 US dollars. He was travelling to Dubai. Officials stated that the currency was concealed inside the side false layer of his handbag to avoid detection. Upon questioning, the man failed to produce valid documents for the currency.

356.title: Video of 8-year-old twin sisters confusing Viswanathan Anand with a question goes viral
356.article_body: A video of eight-year-old twin sisters confusing ex-world chess champion Viswanathan Anand with a question during Chess Olympiad went viral. Sharing it, Anand wrote, "Question of the day." In the video, one of the twin sisters seemingly asked, "How to reset the pieces?" and while Anand started answering, she interrupted, saying, "No...How to distract...pieces?" Anand replied, "I've no idea."

357.title: Price hike is normal: Kartik on rumours of increasing fee by ₹40cr
357.article_body: Reacting to rumours of increasing his fee by ₹40 crore, Kartik Aaryan neither confirmed nor denied it. He said a price hike is normal if a film is able to earn a certain amount because of the combined success rate of everyone involved. "You need to find a balance...You don't want the hike to seem to be unreal," Kartik added.

358.title: BESCOM engineer caught taking bribe of ₹1.3 lakh in Bengaluru
358.article_body: An assistant engineer of Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM) was caught taking a bribe of ₹1.3 lakh by Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) officials on Monday. The engineer reportedly demanded ₹3 lakh to provide electricity connection to an apartment in Marappa Garden near Benson Town. ACB officials claim that an electrical contractor from RT Nagar requested for the line approval.

359.title: Pat Cummins marries his longtime British girlfriend, shares pic
359.article_body: Australia Test captain Pat Cummins tied the knot with his longtime girlfriend Becky Boston, who is a British-born interior designer. Sharing a picture on Instagram, he wrote, "Just married." The couple got engaged in February 2020 and they were blessed with their first child last year.  Several cricketers, including David Warner, congratulated the couple.

360.title: Mahindra & Mahindra shares hit all-time high after Scorpio-N bookings soar
360.article_body: Shares of Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M) hit an all-time high of ₹1,247 apiece on Monday. On Saturday, the company recorded 1,00,000 bookings for the all-new Scorpio-N within 30 minutes of the booking commencement, with over 25,000 bookings within one minute. Notably, this was the fifth consecutive session when the stock traded higher.

361.title: 26-yr-old peddler arrested in Pune; mephedrone drug worth ₹1.07 crore seized
361.article_body: Pune Police arrested a 26-year-old peddler and seized mephedrone drug worth ₹1.07 crore in the city's Vimannagar area. The accused, Ravindra Arvind Birhade, was caught in a police-laid trap and then, booked under sections 8(c), 21(c) and 29 of the Narcotics Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act, police said. Notably, the police acted on a tip-off to catch Birhade.

362.title: 10 dead due to flooding amid heavy rains in Uganda: Red Cross
362.article_body: At least 10 people have died after heavy rains caused flooding that burst river banks in eastern Uganda, the Red Cross said on Sunday. The deceased are from the neighbouring districts of Kapchorwa and Mbale. "This disaster is due to environmental degradation...How many people are going to die like this?" the country's PM Robinah Nabbanja told reporters.

363.title: NZ fully reopens borders for 1st time since COVID-19 pandemic began
363.article_body: New Zealand on Monday fully reopened its borders to visitors for the first time since coronavirus pandemic began in March 2020. It'll now allow visitors who need visas and those on student visas to return. Cruise ships and foreign recreational yachts will also be allowed to dock at the country's ports. Most visitors will still need to be fully vaccinated.

364.title: Thanks Modi ji, do we pay GST on this too: Srinivas on Bihar minister's video
364.article_body: While tweeting the video of Bihar minister Ram Surat Rai telling people that they're all alive because of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Indian Youth Congress National President Srinivas BV said, "Thank you Modi ji, do we pay GST on this too?" Rai was speaking to the crowd about the COVID-19 pandemic.

365.title: 38 students ill after worms, insects found in Telangana school's food
365.article_body: Around 38 students fell ill, four had to be hospitalised and four others were kept in observation after consuming a meal provided at a tribal welfare gurukul school in Telangana's Mahabubabad. Students have stated that they complained after finding earthworms and insects in the food but the authorities did not pay heed. The hostel houses around 953 students.

366.title: 3 of family killed after train engine hits car at railway crossing in Assam
366.article_body: A car was hit by a train engine at the Puranigudam railway crossing in Assam's Nagaon district on Sunday night, which led to the death of three members of a family. All three died on the spot and have been identified as Chandra Kalita, Nilima Devi and Sunny Kalita, police said. Notably, the train was coming from Silghat.

367.title: 22-year-old Kanwariya dies after car hits bike in UP's Etah
367.article_body: A 22-year-old Kanwariya died and two others got injured after a car hit their motorbike in Etah, Uttar Pradesh. The incident took place at 3:30 am on Monday, police said. Notably, the car occupants were en route to Soron to immerse the ashes of a relative in the Ganges river, police added. The deceased was identified as Vinay.

368.title: It's something I'll never forget: Alia on 'Heart of Stone' shoot
368.article_body: Alia Bhatt, sharing her experience of working on her Hollywood debut 'Heart of Stone', said it's something that she'll never forget because of how beautifully she was treated over there. "I'd quite a task at hand...because I was shooting for...first time an action movie...I'm also pregnant...so there were so many layers...to deal with...But they made it so easy," she added.

369.title: West Bengal's cabinet reshuffle on Aug 3, CM says there will be 4-5 new faces
369.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday announced that cabinet reshuffle in the state will take place on Wednesday (August 3) and added that there will be four-five new faces in cabinet. "We lost Ministers Subrata Mukherjee, Sadhan Pande. Partha is in jail so all their work has to be done. Not possible for me to handle alone," Mamata said.

370.title: Not appropriate to run proceedings this way: Om Birla as LS adjourned amid protest
370.article_body: The Lok Sabha was adjourned on Monday following a protest by the Opposition MPs. “I want to maintain the dignity of the House. It’s not appropriate to run the proceedings this way,” Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla said as the lower house was adjourned till 12 pm today. Later, the Lok Sabha was again adjourned till 2 pm today.

371.title: Alibaba looks to maintain NY listing after addition to US delisting watchlist
371.article_body: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holdings Ltd said it would work to maintain listings on New York Stock Exchange and Hong Kong. On Friday, US Securities and Exchange Commission added Alibaba to a list of 270 other Chinese firms that might be delisted for failing to comply with American auditing standards. US regulators demand full access to audit working papers.

372.title: 6-yr-old girl writes letter to PM Modi on rising cost of pencil, maggi; pic goes viral
372.article_body: A six-year-old girl's letter to PM Narendra Modi about the rising prices of pencil, eraser, and maggi has gone viral on social media. "Modi ji, you have caused an immense price rise...Now my mother beats me for asking for a pencil. What shall I do? Other kids steal my pencil," the girl from Uttar Pradesh's Kannauj wrote in the letter.

373.title: Forced to work as sex slave in prison, says former Israeli guard; PM orders probe
373.article_body: A former guard at a maximum security prison in Israel has alleged she was repeatedly raped by a Palestinian inmate after being forced to work as a "sex slave" by her superiors. Israeli PM Yair Lapid promised an investigation, saying, "It cannot be (tolerated) that a soldier is raped by a terrorist during her service."

374.title: Man forced to tie mother's body to bike, ride 80km after MP hospital denies hearse van
374.article_body: A man in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol was forced to tie his dead mother's body to a motorcycle and ride it back to his village 80 km away allegedly after district hospital didn't provide a hearse van. The man reportedly couldn't afford private vehicles that asked for ₹5,000. The woman's sons alleged she died due to lack of proper treatment.

375.title: Opposition's voice being stifled using govt machinery: Shiv Sena MP
375.article_body: The people of the country are watching how voice of the Opposition is being stifled using the government machinery, Shiv Sena MP Anil Desai said on Monday. His statement came after party MP Sanjay Raut was arrested by the ED on Sunday night, after hours of questioning in relation with alleged money laundering linked to redevelopment of a Mumbai chawl.

376.title: Kerala CM cautions people amid heavy rain warning
376.article_body: Kerala CM P Vijayan has warned the public to exercise caution amid forecast of heavy rainfall. Government agencies have been instructed to be on alert and people living in low-lying areas have been advised to evacuate. “As the India Meteorological Department has warned of heavy rains in the state for next five days, people should be very vigilant,” said Vijayan.

377.title: Taliban denies 'drone attack' in Kabul, says rocket hit empty house
377.article_body: A spokesperson from the Taliban's Interior Ministry on Sunday denied reports of a drone attack in Afghanistan's Kabul and said that a rocket had hit an empty house, reported TOLO news. Earlier, Afghanistan's former National Directorate of Security (NDS) head Rahmatullah Nabil had tweeted, "As per ground sources...American drones were seen in (Kabul's) airspace...and struck different locations."

378.title: Woman who started as a sweeper, becomes AGM at SBI in Mumbai 37 years later
378.article_body: A woman, aged 20, who started working as a part-time sweeper at an SBI branch in Mumbai after her husband's demise, has risen to become the bank's Assistant General Manager 37 years later. Pratiksha Tondwalkar got married at the age of 16, before completing her Class 10 exams. She cleared her subsequent studies after joining the bank as a sweeper.

379.title: Not in favour of Pant opening, he's India’s pivotal player: Reetinder Sodhi
379.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Reetinder Sodhi has said he doesn't want Rishabh Pant to open for India in T20Is as the wicketkeeper-batter is the team's pivotal player. "India need him when the game gets tight in the 15th-16th over. You can better utilise him in the middle overs," stated Sodhi. Pant opened in two T20Is in England and scored 26 and 1.

380.title: Lawyer who filed PILs against Jharkhand CM arrested in Kolkata
380.article_body: Lawyer Rajiv Kumar, who had filed PILs against Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren over corruption, was arrested by Kolkata Police on Sunday for allegedly cheating people of ₹50 lakh. Kumar was picked up from a bar under the Hare Street police station area following a warrant issued against him by Jharkhand Police. Stacks of money were reportedly found on him.

381.title: Which states have received less than normal rainfall so far?
381.article_body: India Meteorological Department data showed that till July 31, UP had a rain deficiency of 46%, Jharkhand 49%, Bihar 39% and West Bengal 26%. There has also been 16% rain deficiency over eastern and northeastern India. IMD DGM Mrutyunjay Mohapatra said there were above normal rains over central and peninsular India, but high deficiency over states in the Gangetic plains.

382.title: 325+ K'taka buses booked for Siddaramaiah's b'day, hundreds more to be booked
382.article_body: More than 325 buses of the Northwest Karnataka Road Transport Corporation have been booked for the celebration of 75th birth anniversary programme of Congress leader Siddaramaiah in Davanagere. Reports said that hundreds of more buses are expected to be booked. Reports added that preparations to invite and take 5000-6000 workers from each assembly constituency of the district.

383.title: Arjun, Tara hold housefull board for 'Ek Villain Returns' at Gaiety Cinema
383.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor shared a picture on Sunday of holding a housefull sign outside Mumbai's Gaiety Cinema for his film 'Ek Villain Returns'. Arjun was joined by his co-stars Tara Sutaria and Disha Patani. He wrote alongside the picture, "Housefull board outside a cinema that's all we work for." The film has earned $1 million at the global box office.

384.title: Kichcha Sudeepa's 'Vikrant Rona' crosses ₹100cr worldwide after 1st weekend
384.article_body: Kichcha Sudeepa-starrer 'Vikrant Rona' is estimated to have collected over ₹110 crore worldwide within four days of its release. As per estimates from the industry, it earned approximately ₹29 crore on Sunday.  The film was released in five languages including Kannada, Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam and Hindi. It is directed by Anup Bhandari and also features Nirup Bhandari and Neetha Ashok.

385.title: Loud music at night to end soon: Hyderabad Police Commissioner
385.article_body: Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand said that authorities will soon put an end to loud music being played at night. His statement comes after loud music was played near his residence in wee hours of Sunday. The commissioner said that he called 100 and did not reveal his identity while making the complaint and was happy with police's quick response.

386.title: Pat Carroll, voice behind Disney villain Ursula in Little Mermaid, dies at 95
386.article_body: American actress and comedian Pat Carroll, voice behind Disney villain Ursula in 'The Little Mermaid', has passed away at the age of 95. Carroll died on Saturday of pneumonia at her home in Massachusetts, her daughter Kerry Karsian told The Hollywood Reporter. Carroll won an Emmy for her work on the sketch comedy series 'Caesar's Hour' in 1956.

387.title: Raut held for non-cooperation, unaccounted cash & incriminating documents: ED
387.article_body: As per Hindustan Times, the Enforcement Directorate officials said that Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut was arrested due to "non-cooperation", "unaccounted cash recovered at his residence", and recovery of "incriminating documents" from his place. ED had detained Raut after conducting a search for over nine hours at Raut's Bhandup residence on Sunday.

388.title: Sanjay Arora takes charge as Delhi Police Commissioner
388.article_body: Sanjay Arora, a senior IPS officer of Tamil Nadu cadre, took charge as the Commissioner of Delhi Police today (August 1). The 57-year-old officer was accorded the ceremonial guard of honour by the police force upon his arrival at the Delhi Police Headquarters. He will succeed Rakesh Asthana who retired on Sunday (July 31) after nearly 38 years in service.

389.title: 16-year-old student confirmed as 1st monkeypox case in Sudan
389.article_body: Sudan's Health Ministry said in a statement on Sunday that the country has recorded its first monkeypox case. The statement added that a 16-year-old student was confirmed to be infected with the disease on Thursday in West Darfur state. A senior official from the ministry said that the other 38 suspected cases of the disease have all tested negative.

390.title: Beirut grain silo damaged in 2020 blast collapses after weeks-long fire
390.article_body: A section of grain silo at Beirut port collapsed on Sunday, after weeks-long fire triggered by summer heat fermented grains. Last week, Lebanese officials had warned that a part of the silo could collapse after it started tilting. The incident reminded the capital city of the horrors of the 2020 explosion that left 215 people dead, Reuters reported.

391.title: Truly a proud moment as Achinta from WB wins CWG gold: Mamata Banerjee
391.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee took to Twitter to congratulate 20-year-old weightlifter Achinta Sheuli for winning the gold medal in the men's 73-kg category at the CWG 2022. "Truly a proud moment for all of us as young Achinta from West Bengal wins gold...Your success will serve as an inspiration to countless others in the country," tweeted CM Banerjee.

392.title: Bihar minister tells crowd 'You're alive because of PM Modi', video viral
392.article_body: In a video that has gone viral on social media, Bihar minister Ram Surat Rai, a BJP leader, can be seen telling a crowd, "If you all...are alive today...it is because of...[PM] Narendra Modi." He said so while talking about COVID-19 pandemic. "We were saved by...Modi's vaccine and his deft handling of economy," he can be seen saying in video.

393.title: Telangana government to distribute 1 crore national flags
393.article_body: The Telangana government will celebrate 'Swatantra Bharatha Vajrotsavalu' for two weeks from August 8 in wake of the nation's 75th Independence Day. It will distribute 1 crore national flags for hoisting across the state. Films on unity and patriotism will also be shown free of cost to school children in all the cinema halls.

394.title: Before Satya's release, SRK joked 'remove JD & put me in film': JD
394.article_body: Actor JD Chakravarthy recalled how he got a phone call from Shah Rukh Khan the evening before Satya's release. "He said, 'If 'Satya' is to become...disaster, what do you think we should do?' I got offended and said, 'You tell me what we should do'," JD said, adding, "Shah Rukh said, 'Replace JD...with Shah Rukh.' I understood he was joking."

395.title: People feel I don't like India: Aamir Khan on 'boycott Laal Singh Chaddha' Twitter trend
395.article_body: Reacting to 'boycott Laal Singh Chaddha' trend on Twitter, Aamir Khan said, "I feel sad that some of the people who are saying this, in their heart, they believe that I am someone who doesn't like India....but it is untrue." Calling it unfortunate that people feel that way, he urged, "Please don't boycott my film."

396.title: Why is China's real estate sector currently facing a crisis?
396.article_body: China's real estate sector is currently facing a crisis as buyers across the country have stopped paying mortgages for homes sold before completion. The boycott comes after the sector was hit by a funding crisis, leading to defaults and stalled projects. Meanwhile, S&P Global Ratings estimated that Chinese banks could face $356 billion in losses due to the ongoing crisis.

397.title: That's gonna be crazy one: Naga on if he will do a film with Samantha
397.article_body: During an interview, actor Naga Chaitanya was asked if he and his ex-wife Samantha Prabhu will ever share screen space in a film. To this, the actor replied, "That's gonna be a crazy one if it happens. But I don't know, only the universe knows. Let's see." Naga and Samantha announced their split on Instagram in October 2021.

398.title: Shreyas is ahead of Hooda in pecking order: Saba Karim on no.3 spot in T20Is
398.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Saba Karim has said Shreyas Iyer is ahead of Deepak Hooda in the pecking order for the number three position in India's T20I playing XI. "That being the case, he will have to be given a few more chances in the upcoming games," added Karim. Shreyas got out for a duck in the first T20I against West Indies.

399.title: 4 arrested in Bengaluru for blackmailing widows, divorcees over nude videos
399.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested four members of a gang for allegedly assaulting, blackmailing and extorting widows and divorced women over nude videos. The accused, including a woman, targeted the victims under the pretext of helping them out with financial assistance and jobs, the police said. They later kidnapped the victim and would threaten them to strip and made nude videos.

400.title: India's manufacturing PMI surges to 8-month high of 56.4 in July
400.article_body: India's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI), compiled by S&P Global, surged to an eight-month high amid growth in new orders and output. The PMI rose to 56.4 in July as compared to 53.9 in June and 54.6 in May. The July PMI data indicated an improvement in overall operating conditions for the 13th straight month.

401.title: Issue of 'Operation Keechad’ in J’khand to be raised in Parliament: Kharge
401.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Monday said that the Opposition will raise the issues of inflation and the Gujarat hooch tragedy in the Parliament. "'Operation Keechad' by them (BJP) in Jharkhand will also be raised today," Kharge added. His statement came after three Jharkhand MLAs were caught with huge amount of cash on Saturday. They were suspended from Congress.

402.title: Firefighters battle blaze near Lisbon amid strong winds
402.article_body: More than 400 firefighters, backed by water-bombers and 123 vehicles, battled a blaze burning near Lisbon, the capital city of Portugal. Soaring temperatures and strong winds made it more difficult to put out the fire, forcing authorities to block several roads, reports said. Portugal has been facing a heatwave, like other parts of Europe, with temperatures reaching 40 degree Celsius.

403.title: GST collection hits nearly ₹1.49 lakh crore in July, second-highest ever
403.article_body: The government on Monday said that ₹1,48,995 crore gross GST revenue was collected in July 2022, marking the second highest amount of revenue collected since the introduction of GST. The revenues for July are 28% higher than the GST revenues in the same month last year. The highest GST collection ever recorded was in April 2022 at ₹1.68 lakh crore.
